hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp (>5%) intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines), but the BTC perpetual funding rate remains neutral/positive and spot volumes spike >200% above 20-day average, a mean reversion bounce of 2-3% occurs within 6 hours as opportunistic liquidity enters to fill the gap.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent 'structural shift' narrative suggests liquidity has become more opportunistic. Sharp news-driven drops on high volume often represent panic selling rather than structural outflows. Neutral/positive funding indicates leveraged longs aren't driving the drop. High spot volume suggests capitulation, creating liquidity vacuum for quick reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes >5% below previous close
BTC perpetual funding rate > -0.001% (not heavily negative)
Spot volume (BTC/USD) > 200% of 20-day average for that hour
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price continues dropping >2% below entry after 6 hours with funding turning negative (<-0.005%) and volume declining, hypothesis fails.
